info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 10:57AM EDT until April 7 at 1:33AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Raccoon Creek near Fincastle.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Raccoon Creek near Fincastle.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland flooding in progress along portions of Big Raccoon Creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.7 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall late this afternoon. It will rise to 12.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall late tomorrow morning. It will rise to 11.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 200 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING
